title: Add family trees/branches to data structure.
Hard to scroll past map on mobile
body:
The map takes up so much screen it is hard to tap and drag from somewhere on the actual page. 

Maybe we could give up a narrow column for instruction, a legend, or  short copy.

title: Append Points to Submitted Path
body: After user has submitted a path, if they click one of the endpoints they could get a prompt that allows them to append more points to it.

title: Should we, in addition to collecting email addresses, ask for other info? Such as a name and/or a 'notes' section to allow people to optionally talk about their submission.
Have leaflet zoom to lat/lng bounds once the user layer animation begins.
Add a button to re-draw the animation on command (within a reasonable time limit)
body: Let's show off our snakes, people.

title: After animation. Click line to highlight it individually.
UI for submissions

milestone.title: Test Launch
milestone.description: Live version ready to go to share at Chi Hack Night for user feedback before the 6th.

body:
User well click a button on/near the map to begin submission process.
- User uses pelias window to search for location. 
- Once they select a result, marker is drawn with pop-out name for the place. Confirmation button in the popout will add it to a user leaflet layer group, styled different than the stranger/all layer.
- The input will reset for each new submission. Each previous point will stay on the map.
- Once the user has put in at least two points, they will have the option to confirm the entire user layer. *Once that's done, the snake animation is drawn on those points for the user layer, the new coordinate array is pushed to the backend, and the master layer will turn back on.

title: Is the update endpoint open to sql injection?
custom labels/colors for each generation + line styles
body: Dashed lines for older generations, etc?

title: User prompts/instructions for confirming points and submitting an entry

milestone.title: Test Launch
milestone.description: Live version ready to go to share at Chi Hack Night for user feedback before the 6th.

body:
p1: "Where do you live now?"

p2: "Thanks! So you currently live at 'p1submission'. Where did you grow up?"

p3: "Thanks! So you grew up at 'p2submission'. Where are one of your parents from?" 

p4:"Thanks! So one of your parents is from 'p3submission'. What about a grand-parent?"

p5:"Thanks! A grand-parent was from 'p4submmision'. Finally, where is a great-grandparent from?"

title: Periodically remove duplicate entries
body: Potential enhancement: Run a SQL statement deleting rows where all p\* submissions match to avoid duplicate/useless entries.

title: After submission, prompt user to enter email
body:
After the user submits their points, the site should pop up a box/route to a prompt for email.

"Thanks for submitting? Would you like to provide your email address to stay in touch with this project?"

We could store the emails in a new table on CartoDB, but that data would be public. We either need a private CartoDB instance or need to setup another db to store results.
